properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 7 at 3:43AM AKST until February 9 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills occuring. Heavy snow and blowing
snow is expected to develop early Saturday. Plan on difficult
travel conditions. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches
are expected. Expect wind chills as cold as 45 below zero.

* WHERE...Lower Yukon Valley.

* WHEN... For the Wind Chill Advisory, now to midnight Saturday.For
the Winter Storm Warning, midnight to 3 AM Sunday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will cause
areas of blowing and drifting snow reducing the visibility to
one half mile or less at times Saturday and Saturday night. The
cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes
to exposed skin.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow and blowing snow means severe
winter weather conditions are expected. This will make travel
very difficult or impossible.

A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind
speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite
and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 3 AM AKST SUNDAY
